headline: Modi Seizes AI Summit to Assert India’s Global Ambitions After Tough Year
summary: Two months into the new year, he’s secured major trade pacts with the European Union and the US, will host several foreign leaders in the coming weeks who want to clinch their own deals, is riding a wave of popular support following key state elections, and his top officials expect economic growth will beat the government’s own forecasts.  This week, Modi will have an opportunity to showcase not only India’s global ambitions but also his own resurgence when he takes the stage at a high profile artificial intelligence summit in New Delhi.  In attendance at the India AI Impact Summit will be more than a dozen heads of state, including from France and Brazil, and some of the most influential leaders in the tech world — from OpenAI’s Sam Altman to Sundar Pichai of Alphabet Inc. to Anthropic PBC’s Dario Amodei.

content.title: Modi Seizes AI Summit to Assert India’s Global Ambitions After Tough Year
content.summary: Two months into the new year, he’s secured major trade pacts with the European Union and the US, will host several foreign leaders in the coming weeks who want to clinch their own deals, is riding a wave of popular support following key state elections, and his top officials expect economic growth will beat the government’s own forecasts.  This week, Modi will have an opportunity to showcase not only India’s global ambitions but also his own resurgence when he takes the stage at a high profile artificial intelligence summit in New Delhi.  In attendance at the India AI Impact Summit will be more than a dozen heads of state, including from France and Brazil, and some of the most influential leaders in the tech world — from OpenAI’s Sam Altman to Sundar Pichai of Alphabet Inc. to Anthropic PBC’s Dario Amodei.

headline: Peter Thiel's Palantir Extends Partnership With Boeing Rival Airbus
summary: Software company Palantir Technologies Inc. (NASDAQ:PLTR), co-founded by Peter Thiel, has announced the expansion of its partnership with aircraft manufacturer Airbus SE (OTC:EADSY) (OTC:EADSF). Multi-Year Agreement In an official press release published on Tuesday, the companies announced the extension of their collaboration after signing a multi-year agreement on the open data platform Skywise, developed jointly by the two companies. summary: The anime streaming market, valued at USD 7.50 Billion in 2024, is forecasted to grow to USD 14.65 Billion by 2030, at a CAGR of 11.81%. The US-China trade war in 2025 increased regulatory barriers, impacting anime licensing and distribution, particularly for Chinese studios. US-based platforms face higher acquisition costs due to compliance checks on Chinese-origin content. Global platforms focus on diversifying content sourcing to Japan, South Korea, and Southeast Asia. headline: Adani bets $100 billion on data centres to power India’s AI ambitions
summary: Adani Enterprises said on Tuesday that it will invest $100 billion to build renewable-powered AI-ready data centres by 2035, positioning India as ‌a contender in the global AI race.  India has seen a surge in big-ticket AI infrastructure spending, ‌with global players like Google, Amazon, Meta Platforms and Microsoft ramping up investments along with domestic companies such as Reliance and ​TCS.  "AI-ready data centres would be a critical nerve centre of the AI-driven environment and it's natural that large groups with deep pockets will get future-ready by setting up such data centres," said Ambareesh Baliga, an independent market analyst.

content.title: Adani bets $100 billion on data centres to power India’s AI ambitions
content.summary: Adani Enterprises said on Tuesday that it will invest $100 billion to build renewable-powered AI-ready data centres by 2035, positioning India as ‌a contender in the global AI race.  India has seen a surge in big-ticket AI infrastructure spending, ‌with global players like Google, Amazon, Meta Platforms and Microsoft ramping up investments along with domestic companies such as Reliance and ​TCS.  "AI-ready data centres would be a critical nerve centre of the AI-driven environment and it's natural that large groups with deep pockets will get future-ready by setting up such data centres," said Ambareesh Baliga, an independent market analyst.

headline: Dan Ives Calls AI-Driven Software Selloff 'Most Disconnected Trade,' Says Salesforce And ServiceNow Are Historic Buys
summary: On Friday, Wedbush analyst Dan Ives said Wall Street is misreading the impact of artificial intelligence on enterprise software. AI Disruption Fears Spark Software Rout Speaking on CNBC's "Closing Bell," Ives said investors are pricing in an unrealistic scenario in which AI tools rapidly replace traditional software platforms. "The most disconnected trade I've ever seen in my career on Wall Street," Ives said, referring to the sharp pullback in large-cap software stocks. Don't Miss: The AI Marke
